title: Commander Keen: Monky Business (OrbKeen)
content:
I have been working on the first episode of this trilogy, a Keen1 mod named 'Essence of Mayhem', since August 2003, when I first joined this forum. For some reason it's always had the codename 'OrbKeen'. It's evolved a lot since its conception, and shall mutate even further when I start working on it again.

The project page can be viewed at the following URL:

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/spleen/projects/monky.html]jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/...monky.html[/url]

The beta, which was released late 2004, can be downloaded here:

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/spleen/archive/orbkbeta.zip]jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/...bkbeta.zip[/url]

I'd be very interested to hear any comments, questions or suggestions y'all may have, now that there's a place for such things.

title: Re: Commander Keen: Monky Business (OrbKeen)
content:
I played your beta back when you first released it - I'm pretty sure I was impressed by it (looking at your screenshots, I am impressed now, so I guess I was back then). I can't remember any of the gameplay, but next time I get some spare time, I'll have another play of it and be able to give you some better comments.

It's good to hear that you're going to finish it.

title: Re: Commander Keen: Monky Business (OrbKeen)
content:
Hmmm, I vote this 'longest mod production time' mod.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Commander Keen: Monky Business (OrbKeen)
content:
"Hmmm, I vote this 'longest mod production time' mod."
Hehe, I can't compete as I never work very long on a project. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Well, this is definitely worth waiting. The beta is just awesome, I've played it through a few times and should do that again.. This'll be great once done.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
